result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J. Patterson

records.addlTxt: Criminal case settlement

cases #14CF35, #14CF101, #14CF215 called at 3:45pm. [MK]
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiries, Mr. Patterson verifies that he is satisfied with Attorney Svehlek's representation, and wishes for her to continue as his counsel.
As to Case #14CF215 only:  Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest  " entered on Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Mr. Patterson guilty of Counts #1 & #3, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #4, and #5. 
--------------------------------------------------------------
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  Mr. Patterson makes a statement. 

In Case #14CF35, on Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to:
--serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; to commence forthwith
--to pay costs of $243, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge,  plus $200 DNA surcharge, plus $149.88 for officer overtime 
In Case #14CF35 on Count #5 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to: 
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Count #1 
--to pay costs of $243, plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge, plus $200 DNA surcharge
--71 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Patterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.


----------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #14CF101 on Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Case #14CF35
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--1 day credit for time already served given
--Mr. Patterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #14CF215 on Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
In Case #14CF215 on Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Patterson to: 
--serve one month in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; consecutive to Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 and to Count #1 of this case.
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--1 day credit for time already served given
--Mr. Patterson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court indicates that if Mr. Patterson tests positive for alcohol or illegal drugs on any one of his jail sentences, then the resulting revocation of Huber privileges shall be as to all sentences in these cases that remain to be served.
The $500 cash bail amount in Case #14CF35 is to be applied, if it has not been forfeited or refunded to date.  The Court orders entry of civil judgments for the remaining unpaid court financial obligations in each case.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.  
Recess 4:24pm.
from Defendant regarding counsel
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek

cases #14CF35, #14CF101, #14CF215 called at 3:28pm. 
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On request of Mr. Patterson, the Court removes Attorney Buckett as PD counsel in these cases; the Public Defender is to appoint successor counsel.

cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 and #14CF215 called at 2:32pm. 
Attorney Robert W Buckett in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases #14CF35 and #14CF101 were scheduled for Sentencing Hearing today, and Case #14CF215 was scheduled for Status Conference today, however Mr. Patterson has contacted court staff to say that the car of the person he was getting a ride from has broken down, and neither the transport person or Mr. Patterson have any funds to pay for any road service or repair.  
The Court expresses its inclination to issue bench warrants, however after a discussion with counsel on scheduling, instead, the Court grants the request of Attorney Buckett to schedule the cases as shown below.  However the Court indicates to Attorney Buckett that it will not put off sentencing on the two cases if a global settlement has not been reached at that point. 
recess 2:40pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/9/14 at 10:40am (2) reschedule Cases #14CF35 & #14CF101 for Sentencing, and set Case #14CF215 for Preliminary Hearing, all on same date/time during the first week in August

cases #14CF35, #14CF101 called called at 9:25am. 
Attorney Robert W Buckett.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant in each case.
cases re-called at 9:49am.
Defendant Adam J. Patterson now appears in court with Attorney Robert W Buckett.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court vacates its Warrant Orders in each case. 

The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Patterson, verifying that he understands and joins in the plea agreement. 
The charges and maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; elements recited.
In response to Mr. Patterson's indicating that he has reading problems, and that while Attorney Buckett read the Complaints to him, he does not recall the factual details, the Court goes through each Criminal Complaint, going over the events and details set forth in each Complaint.  Mr. Patterson agrees that there is a factual basis for the Court to accept pleas to the charges.


Pleas of " Guilty" entered in Case #14CF35 on Count #1 and Count #5, and in case #14CF101 in Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Patterson guilty of Case #14CF35 on Count #1 and Count #5, and in case #14CF101 in Count #2, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2, Count #3, Count #4 and Count #6 in 14CF35 and Count #1 in 14CF101; so ordered by the Court. 

On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule Sentencing on a later date.
recess 10:08am.

NEXT:  (Notices to be mailed.)
Schedule both cases for Sentencing Hearing in approximately 2 to 3 weeks out - 30 minutes needed. 
(Clerk's note re scheduling, defendant taken into custody on a warrant in another case at the end of the hearing.)
for Continuance
Status conference on June 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Proposed STAO for continuance, forwarded to the Court for review
Status conference on June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

cases #14CF35 & #14CF101 called at 9:04am. 
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Buckett acknowledges receipt of Dr. Schoenecker's report.
On agreement of the parties, and based on the report of Dr. Schoenecker, the Court finds that Mr. Patterson is competent to proceed in these two cases.
The Court removes the 4/15/14 Competency Hearing from its calendar. 

The Court addresses the State' 3/24/14 Motion to Modify Bond in Case #14CF35:
--arguments given by counsel
--the Court reviews with Mr. Patterson the conditions of bond in case #14CF101, indicating they remain in full force and effect
--the Court grants the Motion and modifies the Bond in Case #14CF35 to a $500 cash bond with the conditions: 
----to maintain absoloute sobriety
----no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
---- no acts or theats of violence
----no direct or indirect contact with Ashley Aussem, to include but not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media or other electronic means; no one can contact Ms. Aussem on Mr. Patterson's behalf, with the except of Mr. Patterson's attorney
-- no presence at the residence of Ashley Aussem or any location where Ashley Aussem may temporarily reside 
----continued SCRAM monitoring; if the SCRAM bracelet is removed by Jail staff, then Mr. Patterson is to report to Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse to re-install the SCRAM bracelet at 1:00pm on the Thursday immediately following his release from custody
recess 9:12am.

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/9/14 at 9:40am  (2) schedule case #14CF101 for Preliminary Hearing and case #14CF35 for Status on same date and time (please avoid the dates of 5/3-5/8/14 to accomodate Attorney Buckett's calendar)
Motion hearing on March 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 1:49 pm
Defendant Adam J. Patterson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews the conflict review worksheet, the Court in it's former compacity was the prosecutor assigned to one of Mr. Patterson's previous cases. Court concludes that there is no conflict.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Counts #1- #6.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Ashley Aussem
-No presence at any residence where Ashley Aussem resides or may temporarily reside 
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 1/23/14 at 1:30 pm. 

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.

Recess: 2:13 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 2/10/14 at 8:30 am (parties agreed on this date)
Probable cause statement
